isis.stitle: BRAKE COMPONENTS: This Service Manual Section should be used for reference only. For more current service information on all components go to the Bendix website from the ISIS Suppliers menu and refer to the Service Data Sheets. - CHECK VALVES - ONE WAY CHECK VALVE

svcsubproc.title: Description
svcsubproc.para: The one-way check valve ( Figures 11 and 12 ) permits one-way passage of air pressure as indicated by the arrow on the side of the valve. Valves are installed at both the primary and secondary reservoirs to maintain the air supply if an air loss should occur ahead of the valve.

figure.caption: Figure 12. One Way Check Valve - Clearance Limitation

svcsubproc.para: The 90°angle check valve shown in Figure 12 is used in applications where clearance limitations exist.

svcsubproc.title: Operation
svcsubproc.para: Air flow through the valve moves the seal from its seat. This allows an unobstructed passage. Air flow in the reverse direction is prevented by the seal which reseats, blocking passage. An assistance spring provides additional back-pressure against the seal.

svcsubproc.title: Maintenance
svcsubproc.para: Once each year or every 100,000 miles (160,000 km), check valve operation.

svcsubproc.title: Service Checks
svcsubproc.para: It may be necessary to remove the check valve to check operation. When inspecting valves at primary and secondary reservoirs, bleed air supply reservoir and disconnect the air inlet to valve, then proceed.

With air pressure present at outlet side of check valve and inlet open to atmosphere, test for leakage. Leakage should not exceed 1 inch (25 mm) diameter soap bubble in 5 seconds. If valve leaks excessively, the valve should be repaired or replaced.

step1.para: Apply parking brake and block wheels.
Disconnect air lines. Note direction of arrow on side of valve; remove valve.
Inspect and clean or replace air line to valve.
Install valve, making certain that arrow is pointing in the same direction as when it was removed.
